seg.seg: the four Pratideśanīya-Dharmas have been recited ...
... in such way should one study || ...
... the Buddhas call extinction the best ...
Wie ein Sehender (unebene Wege) [meidet, so] soll der Weise ... das Böse [im Toch. Plural] meiden.
Just like a seeing person [avoids] uneven paths, [just so] shall the wise one ... avoid evils.
... being on a couch in a remote place ...
... taking the juice [away], just so the wise should go [away] from the village. 4. Not the wrong (deeds) of others
… taking the juice [away], just so the wise should go [away] from the village. (cf 75, 78)

Translation [[Ogihara 2009]]: 272-273:
a1 /// By me have been recited the thirty rules which cause to turn with the abandonment [NP.],
a2 have been recited the ninety rules which cause to turn [Pāt.], have been recited the four rules which have to be confessed [Pratid.], have been recited a lot of rules (which are related to) teaching [Śai.]
a3 have been recited the seven rules (making) ... [AŚ.]. This is so far indeed has gone to the the [sic] Sūtra of this renounced one [Bhagavat-],
a4 has been brought in the Sūtra. Which rule of this sort or again another rule being compatible with the Law, in that there it should live by you,
a5 together having the same thinking of approval, rejoicing, not making any fight, having the thinking /// /// provided with the same instruction, having become one (like) water (and) milk,
a6 making splendid the doctrine of the teacher [guru-]. It should be learned in this way. || The forbearance, (that is) the endurance is the best among the austerities [tapas-].
b1 (but) extinction [nirvāṇa-] is the best, say the Buddhas. He has not left the house, the one who torments others, he is not a monk, the one who harms others. (1).
b2 This stanza was the Prātimokṣa under the Buddha Vipaśyin. As the one having eyes /// /// obtaining the power, the wise one should live here in the world,
b3 he should abandon the evils. 2 This stanza was the Prātimokṣa under the Buddha Śikhin. Not accusing, not hurting, and concentrated on Prātimokṣa,
b4 and the knowledge of the measure in the meals, and solitary (lying and sitting). In the meditation /// /// It is the doctrine of Buddha. 3 This stanza was the Prātimokṣa under the Buddha Viśvabhū.
b5 /// they leave after taking up the juice, in this way the sage should go out from the village. 4 No the perverse acts of others
b6 /// ... faults. 5 These two stanzas were the Prātimokṣa under the Buddha Krakasundi.
